page.title: 01FARMLAND EAST OF KILMARNOCK
page.content: This area comprising of gentle hills and rolling farmland commands an excellent view of the Firth of Clyde, thirty miles away, and the Island of Arran in the centre of the Firth. Scattered farmhouses nestle amongst fields mainly left as rough grazing land in which herds of Ayrshire and Fresian dairy cattle graze beside sheep and a few horses. The hamlet of Moscow is the largest centre of population, with its inhabitants ranging from farm labourers to top business men, who find the village well within commuting distance of Glasgow, twenty six miles away, just outside Moscow stands Grougar Primary School, which caters for about fifty children from nearby villages and farms. The present building was completed in time for the start of the 1985 winter term. Apart from this
